Reviews.Title: Works -sort of (with an update - again!)
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I am redoing the whole review on this item based on some further experimentation I have done with it.The video quality is acceptable, given that it is a mini camera with a pinhole lens. Indoor photos will be blurred if you're not perfectly still, as will videos. Outdoor (sunlit) shooting is much better.Now for the main discovery that caused me to remove my previous one-star rating: 16GB memory doesn't work with this camera, at least not with mine. I wondered if the 16G micro SDHD might be an issue, so I picked up an 8GB at Tiger Direct here in town. With an 8G memory, it works. The crashing and shutting down after a few seconds, which were the main complaints I had with it before, have stopped altogether. I have recorded for 30 minutes at a stretch on the 8GB card with no real problems. Apparently it auto-saves every 10 minutes so a 30 minute recording will make 3 files.If you have one of these and it is giving you problems with shutdowns or crashes, try a smaller memory.

Not much of an issue, but I received a pen with silver trim, not gold like the one pictured.

The video quality is NOT in HD but it is acceptable for a camera that small. The audio quality is acceptable too, but it is not in HD. Reviews.Title: AMAZING TECHNOLOGY
Reviews.Author: L. B. JENNINGS
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews, I was hesitant to order this, but the cash layout was small enough that I wasn't get too hurt.  First, the instructions are not clear.  Fortunately, it is simple to operate and if you have any technical inclination, you'll figure it out quickly.  Second, inserting the SIM card was a little nerve wracking as I thought I was going to break such a delicate item.  It just takes a steady hand, and the contacts slide in facing the port.  Finally, the clarity and audio are absolutely amazing for such a small and portable device.  It doesn't work well in low light, but normal room lighting or outdoor ambient provides excellent clarity.  It seems to me that you'd want it in your pocket taking video, but I find myself frequently fidgeting to make sure that it's pointed in the right direction.NOTE:  This shipped from China and took about 10 days.  I was prepared for a month lead time, so I was pleasantly surprised.

It probably had something to do with either it not being fully charged, or the 1gb micro sd card that I was using. I did change it to a SanDisk 8gb. Allot of reviews said that it only came with an instruction manual in some sort of chin-english, which mine did , but mine also came with instructions in real english, so that there is a plus. Just a little friendly advice, the first pen I owned, broke because I twisted it off to quik, and to hard when I went to retrieve the sd card. what you need to do, is hold the pen in the middle, by that gold ring, and GENTLY twist counter clock wise until it is completely un-threaded. Also, do not try to force open the clip on the pen, because just like any other regular pen, it will break off(example: like trying to clip it to the pocket on a pair of jeans).

Reviews.Title: Great idea, but unreliable
Reviews.Author: pegslaw
Reviews.Content: During an era in which no one knows who is photographing you or when, counter-spy activity is crucial.  The HD Spy Pen Hidden Camera Camcorder is a terrific concept: an attractive, functional ball-point pen that records video and audio.  It took over a month to get here.  There is an instructional video about this pen on YouTube which I followed to the letter.  I charged the pen, added the 8 GB microcard recommended, and got exactly one video out of it that was very impressive for such a small device.  After that, never again.  Nothing I did could make it work.  I contacted the company, who offered me a refund minus shipping costs to send the pen back, and then they offered to sell me another one at a 10% discount.  I said no thank you.  They are a very nice, polite company, and I wish them well.  Perhaps they'll make a better version of this item soon.The pen was not expensive--it was $5.00 plus shipping, very cheap--but, as everyone has said about such things, you get what you pay for.  I knew that when I bought the camcorder, and so I'm not miserable--just a little bit disappointed.

It didn't help me out but for the price you get what you pay for so I can't give this any lower then four stars because I knew what I was buying. Just want whoever reads this to know the same.

I am recommending these to my friends and you!Instructions in better English- Hold top power button down for 3 seconds to turn on. Tap same button for photo. I usually just tap the button to see if it takes a pic or not. If it does take a pic the light will flash once. If it doesn't do anything, it has turned itself off.

Reviews.Title: not bad when you learn how it works (and doesn't work)
Reviews.Author: Roger
Reviews.Content: Like other reports I didn't get a 2 gig card to work either. Fortunately I had an extra 8 gig and with it the camera light stayed on. Buyers would probably do better just to spend the few extra bucks to get the memory with the pen. The instructions are poor and it took some experimenting to learn how to get video to work. Pushing the on/off button for two seconds gets the blue light to stay on constantly. Pressing the button quickly while the blue light is on takes a picture. Holding the button for a few seconds while the blue light is on actually results in a red blinking light which (for me) went off after several seconds. I thought the camera was off since there was no light on. However, this is how the video portion worked, at least for me. It makes since in that you really would want no light on when you're taking video! Unfortunately, I can't turn off the video camera unless I connect the pen to my computer. Not very friendly but it does work.
